summary: The Protect Adoptees and American Families Act (PAAF Act) aims to provide automatic U.S. citizenship to certain internationally adopted individuals. It amends Section 320(b) of the Immigration and Nationality Act. The bill outlines conditions for automatic citizenship, including age at adoption, physical presence in the U.S., and lawful admission. It also addresses individuals residing outside the U.S., mandating criminal background checks for visa issuance and excusing grounds based on inadmissibility.
